9.22.17  12:08 pm   I have a hard time coming up with vocal parts. And singing is especially difficult for me. I've had asthma since I was a kid, and other recurring respiratory issues.. so sometimes it's tough to hold out a note for a long time, or to sing a full phrase without having to stop to take a breath, I think it might limit my vocal range too. When I do try and sing, I sound like if  Donald Fagen smoked way too many cigarettes and put a clothespin on his nose. I love music, and I like to think that I am pretty decent on the instruments I play, but so many songs are driven by the vocal parts. Like, I think really the function of instruments in a song is to compliment/accompany the vocals (which should usually be front and center)... Not really singing makes it tough for me to actually come up with vocal parts, so I try to over-compensate with the instruments when I write. But when I do play with a singer, usually there's too much going on with the in strument al arrangements and it sounds too jumbled/cluttered. Any advice for me?

9.22.17  9:07 am   Man! I want to say thank you for being so dedicated with this questions page and your reality page, it's super generous and it has seriously inspired me to let go of fears and try new things. I feel happy and like I'm making progress with my creativity largely thanks to you. I do have a question though, I have two main passions, one is music, songwriting and production (which is already like 10 passions in one), and the other is sustainable food/permaculture/natural building/saving the world which is another several passions and my skills there are still so underdeveloped. I ideally I would love to connect the two but can't see how. Do you think it's totally unrealistic to pursue both of these very different fields simultaneously?

     It's what's freaking me out most at the moment. I know you might not be able to help but I respect your opinion. Thanks again.

9.21.17  7:28 pm   i'm a superfan, but here's something that bugs me about you. you insist that other people cant be involved in the creation of your art, but thats a false claim.

      you treat this very questions page as a piece of art (which is to say, you make it exactly like you like it, exercising artistic judgement in its very existence, creating something truly beautiful and worth paying attention to) and the page's existence is entirely dependent on others -- harnessing their curiosity. I think you're just being defeatist to rule out all collaboration when you have demonstrated on some level that it is within your grasp.

      if anyone can come up with a game plan and a system of ensuring the collaboration is designed in such a way that it results in Desired User Experience, then it's you, and i'm saying that because you figured out the much harder puzzle of becoming unconfused about how to make anything at all. you lament the slowness of your production but rule out th e most p otent soltion instead of making it work for you, with cleverness and ingenuity. manhours are what you need to get the workrate you crave, and, right now, there are more untapped manhours at your disposal out there in the world than you have left in your entire life. ruling out the option of collaboration strikes me as so unlike your philosophy of there being so many shades of gray in every issue and challenge.

      i genuinely believe you can do anything you set your mind to. love, a fan for life

9.21.17  3:47 pm   I really struggle with communicating with others in a work environment, and I don't know how to make small talk so I can appear 'normal' and not stand out as super quiet. I know that I'll be working with other people for the rest of my life in my chosen career path, and I find it impossible to make friends (my only friend was someone I met on a film forum ten years ago) so essentially, how do I navigate this? I hate drawing negative attention to myself but I feel I do that by being so quiet whenever I'm at work, even though I usually have nothing to contribute. It's often presumed something's wrong with me because I remain silent, but I feel absolutely fine most of the time and I'll be polite/reply when spoken to. I only really connect with someone if they have the same level of social ineptitude or have the same very specific and intense interests as me. Please, help a gal out. Thanks.
